Dear Trisha Sverns:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications.
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member at the home has been purchasing alcohol and vape
pens for youth placed at the Independent Living (IL) home. This
staff member has also taken youth to their home. Placement was
made aware of these concerns a few weeks ago.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed in person at the independent living
home on 2/9/2023 and again by phone on 2/15/2023. DHHS
Worker 1 was also present for the interviews. Youth A reported
that she has lived at the independent living home since August 3,
2022. She reported that communication is not great among staff
and there are staff members that can’t be trusted. When asked to
expound, she stated that Staff 1 started letting the youths smoke
and drink in the home in September of 2022, even though it is
against the home’s policies, but Staff 1 denied allowing this when
she was asked about it by other staff and supervisors. Youth A
reported that Staff 1 has brought the youths to the store to buy
vapes and alcohol and would allow the youth to vape while in her
car. Youth A stated that Staff 1 never bought alcohol or vapes for
her but has brought her to the store to buy a vape. Youth A stated
that Staff 1 has seen the youths use their vapes and dab pens and
has told the youths they can smoke marijuana in the home. Youth
A stated that Staff 1 did offer her marijuana edibles once, but
Youth A did not accept. Youth A stated that she reported all of this
to Foster Care Worker and Supervisor a few weeks ago. Youth A
reported that Staff 1 recently became the life skills coach and,
since that time, she no longer allows the youths to smoke and
drink.
Youth A reported that all of the youths have Staff 1’s personal
phone number and some of the youths have been to Staff 1’s
home. Youth A stated that, on one occasion, Staff 1 had to go pick
up her son and asked Youth A if she wanted to ride along. Youth
A stated that she went into Staff 1’s home but stayed just inside
the entryway, which Youth A was able to describe. Youth A stated
that Staff 1 invited her to come to Thanksgiving or Christmas at
Staff 1’s home, but Youth A did not go.
2

Youth B was interviewed in person at the independent living
home on 2/9/2023 and again by phone on 2/15/2023. DHHS
Worker 1 was also present for the interviews. Youth B reported
that she has been at the independent living home since
September of 2022. When asked in youths are allowed to smoke
and drink in the home, Youth B reported that they are not;
however, Staff 1 used to allow them to smoke weed in the home.
She reported that Staff 1 would bring the youths to the liquor store
for alcohol and vapes. She reported that Staff 1 once bought her a
bottle of pink Moscato from a store across the street from
Covenant High School and she and Youth C drank the wine that
night, after staff left for the night. She reported that they broke the
bottle in an empty parking lot sometime later. Youth B reported
that Staff 1 offered to bring Youth B to her home to smoke weed.
Youth B stated that she did not go with Staff 1 to her home
because that’s an inappropriate boundary. She reported that Staff
1 has also bought vapes for other youths and bought alcohol for
Youth C. Youth B stated that she reported this to Foster Care
Worker and Supervisor well as Program Manager, who wrote
down what she told them. Youth B reported that there was an
email that went out from Staff 2 saying that Youth B had run up to
Staff 1 and apologized for making up the allegations. Youth B
stated that this was partly true, because she did apologize to Staff
1 for telling on her and getting her in trouble but was also not sorry
because Staff 1 put the youths in a “predicament.” Youth B denied
ever saying she made up the allegations.
Youth B reported that she rode in Staff 1’s car once while Staff 1
transported her son to Staff 1’s home. Youth B reported that she
stayed in the car and did not go into Staff 1’s home.
Youth C was interviewed in person at the independent living
home on 2/9/2023. DHHS Worker 1 was also present for the
interview. Youth C reported that Staff 1 has been making their
lives hard by lying to the youths and the supervisors. She reported
that Staff 1 used to allow the youths to smoke, but recently got a
promotion, so she no longer does. Youth C stated that, in
December, Staff 1 brought her to the liquor store across from
Covenant High School and bought her Jack Daniels Pink
Lemonade drinks. Youth C reported that Youths A & B were also
in the car when this happened. Youth C reported that Staff 1 has
brought other youth to buy vapes, but Staff 1 didn’t purchase them
for the youths. She reported that Staff 1 has allowed youths to
smoke weed in the home, telling the youths that her only rule was
that they didn’t allow Foster Care Worker to see or smell it. Youth
C reported that the last time the youths smoked weed in the house
3

while Staff 1 was present was sometime in December. Youth C
stated that, 2 days ago, Foster Care Worker asked her about
these allegations and Youth C told her everything. Youth C stated
that Staff 2 sent out an email stating that Youth B was lying about
the allegations, but Staff 1 and Staff 2 made that up.
Youth C reported that she has been to Staff 1’s house 4 times.
She stated that three times was to pick something up or drop off
her son during which Youth C typically stayed in the car. Youth C
also reported that she went out with Staff 1’s family for Halloween
but did not go inside anyone’s home.
Youth D was interviewed in person at the independent living
home on 2/9/2023 and again by phone on 2/15/2023. DHHS
Worker 1 was also present for the interviews. Youth D reported
that she has been at the independent living home for nearly 2
months. She stated that she doesn’t know of anyone using vapes
or smoking marijuana in front of staff. She has never heard of staff
buying vapes or alcohol for the youths or of youths going to staff
member’s homes.
Staff 1 was interviewed in person at the independent living home
on 2/9/2023. DHHS Worker 1 was also present for the interview.
Staff 1 reported that she started working in the home as a Youth
Specialist in January of 2022 and changed positions to Life Skills
Coach in June of 2022. Staff 1 denied allowing youths to drink or
smoke marijuana in the home and denied bringing them to the
store to buy alcohol, drugs, or vapes. She admitted to having seen
youths with vapes in their hands, which she did not confiscate,
despite agency policy being to do so. She stated that she did see
Youth C with a dab pen, which she did report, as required. She
stated that she found a joint in Youth B’s room, which she also
reported. She stated that she has never seen or suspected the
youths of drinking in the home; however, last week, she thought
Youth B and a now former youth were smoking marijuana upstairs
because she heard them doing something and giggling, which she
reported to Foster Care Worker after which Foster Care Worker
completed room checks and found High Noon cans in Youth B’s
room.
Staff 1 reported that she thinks the youths are making these
allegations against her because they don’t like that she makes
them participate in life skills and want to get her fired. Staff 1
stated that Youth B told Foster Care Worker that Staff 1 let them
smoke weed in the home, but the following day, gave Staff 1 a
4

hug and apologized and told Staff 1 that she “shouldn’t have said
that.” Staff 1 stated that Staff 2 was present when this took place.
Staff 1 stated that Youth B did ride with her to transport her son
once because, as she was leaving, Youth B jumped in her car.
She reported that she also brought Youth A to her home once
when she had to pick something up from home. Youth A met her
cat and dog during the visit. Staff 1 stated that there is an agency
policy prohibiting staff members from bringing youth to their own
homes.
Program Manager was interviewed in person at the independent
living home on 2/9/2023. DHHS Worker 1 was also present for the
interview. Program Manager reported on 1/20/2022, Youth A’s
sister called her with allegations that Staff 1 was allowing the
youths to smoke marijuana in the home as long as Foster Care
Worker couldn’t smell it when she arrived at the home. On
1/25/2022, Youth B told Program Manager that Staff 1 used to let
her smoke weed and offered to allow her to smoke weed at Staff
1’s home. Youth B also reported that Staff 1 had brought the
youths to a liquor store to buy drugs and vapes. Program Manager
reported that Foster Care Worker interviewed each of the youths
about the allegations and that their stories were inconsistent.
Program Manager was asked about staff members allowing youth
to go to their homes, to which she responded they are not allowed
to do so and that she would be shocked if Staff 1 had brought
youths to her home.
Supervisor was interviewed in person at the independent living
home on 2/9/2023. DHHS Worker 1 was also present for the
interview. Supervisor reported that 3-4 weeks ago, she heard the
youth’s talking about these allegations after which Supervisor
called Program Manager who was going to handle it. Foster Care
Worker talked to Supervisor about the allegations as well and
stated she would be following up with Program Manager and the
youths. Supervisor stated that Foster Care Worker told her that
the youths’ stories were inconsistent. Supervisor reported that the
youths have told her that they don’t want Staff 1 in the life skills
position and that they don’t like what she is requiring them to do
for life skills.
Supervisor reported that she wasn’t aware of allegations that
youths had been to Staff 1’s home and stated she would be
surprised if any of them had been inside her home.
5

Foster Care Worker was interviewed by phone on 2/15/2023.
DHHS Worker 1 was present for the interview. Foster Care
Worker reported that after Youth A’s sister reported to her in
January that Staff 1 had bought alcohol for some youths, she
interviewed Youth B & Youth C about the allegations. She
reported that she didn’t interview Youth A because she wasn’t at
the home at the time and didn’t answer her phone. Foster Care
Worker stated that she then sat Youth B and Staff 1 down
together and told Staff 1 about the allegations. Staff 1 denied the
allegations and Youth B called her a liar, stating she had proof.
Foster Care Worker then ended the discussion because it was
getting heated. Foster Care Worker stated that Youth C denied
that the allegations were true and showed her a text which Foster
Care Worker believed implied they were making up the
allegations. On February 7 or 8, Youth B told Foster Care Worker
that Staff 1 had bought wine for Youth C sometime in the past. On
that same day, Youth C told Foster Care Worker that Staff 1 had
bought alcohol for the youths.
Foster Care Worker reported that, the same day she received the
allegations from Youth A’s sister, Staff 1 admitted to having seen
the youths with vapes and not taking them away because they
would just get new ones anyway. Foster Care Worker talked to
Staff 1 about agency policy and told her that these items needed
to be confiscated and reported to supervision.
Foster Care Worker reported that staff members aren’t allowed to
bring youths to their homes for holidays.
Staff 2 was interviewed in person at the independent living home
on 2/9/2023. DHHS Worker 1 was also present for the interview.
Staff 2 reported that she has worked at the home for 6 months.
She stated that Staff 1 trained her as a youth specialist. She
stated that, if she, Staff 2, ever finds youths with any illegal
substances, she takes it, takes a picture, then tells Foster Care
Worker and Supervisor. She stated that she doesn’t know of
anyone allowing the youths to smoke or drink or buying them any
substances. She stated that 3 weeks ago, she overheard Youth B
talking to Staff 1 and saying something along the lines of “they
made me do it.” Staff 2 stated that it sounded like Youth A was
talking about having made something up.
Staff 2 has never heard about any youths going to staff members
homes.
6

DHHS Worker reported, during a phone conference held on
3/9/2023, there was a preponderance of evidence and Staff 1 will
have a confirmed case.
Documents Reviewed:
• Searches and Prohibited Items Policy which indicates that
illegal drugs, cigarettes, and alcohol are prohibited in the
home and that, if staff believe a resident is in possession of
a prohibited item, they should immediately inform their
supervisor in writing and document in shift notes.
• Supervision notes from 1/30/2023 documenting that Staff 1
reported having seen a youth smoking a “weed like device”
during life skills training. Staff 1 threatened to take a picture
and the youth placed the item in her bag. Supervisor
reminded Staff 1 of the protocol to report these items to
Foster Care Worker and Supervisor.
• Notes from Foster Care Worker indicating that she spoke to
Youth C in her room on 1/18/2023 at which time Youth C
denied being allowed to smoke/vape in the home.
• Screenshot of a text message provided by a former youth
to Foster Care Worker including the following text:
Youth A “So did [Staff 1] not tell us it was okay to
smoke in the house as long as it doesn’t smell like
weed when [Foster Care Worker] gets there? Or just
the fact that she knows cause she whole is trying to
say [Youth B’s] out for her and [my sister] is lying.”
Youth C “Like tf”
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as a staff member did not
demonstrate the required ability by allowing youths to have vapes
in the home, not following policy by failing to report vapes when
observed and violating policy by bringing youth along to transport
her own child, inviting youth to spend holidays with her family and
allowing at least one youth into her home. Additionally, Staff 1 has
a confirmed case.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2022C0112005 4/15/2022, CAP Approved 5/4/2022
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
